text:
Whoa, I’ve totally never noticed this extra wrapper in my final markup before — very curious! I’d question if it were new, but Occam’s Razor points towards me just not paying enough attention. Interested to see if anyone has more info on this!

Regarding the `no_wrapper` property: to my understanding, this is only applicable for modules included in a template via the `{% module %}` tag. The wrapper in question is the one that allows for selecting modules by directly clicking them in the page builder. It’s occasionally handy for solving selector/structure issues brought about by generated markup, but mostly useful for things like preventing fixed or overlapping elements from z-fighting while working in the page builder.
